summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2018, with an embedded earlier email from March 2016. The 2018 emails involve a request for notes and records from a meeting with Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The 2016 email from Peter Skinner forwards a Page Six article about Epstein's continued relationships with young women and introduces attorney Sigrid McCawley.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.role: Email correspondent, likely a legal or investigative contact
persons.context: He sends emails in 2016 forwarding a news article about Jeffrey Epstein and introduces attorney Sigrid McCawley. In 2018, someone is asking for notes from a meeting with him.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Introduced by Peter Skinner in a 2016 email as one of the lead attorneys on the case who knows the facts very well.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a forwarded 2016 Page Six article about his continued relationships with young women and as the subject of the case Sigrid McCawley is working on.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in an attachment list referencing a complaint in a defamation case against her, where a motion to dismiss was denied.

connections.description: Skinner introduces McCawley in an email chain, indicating they are working together on a case related to Epstein.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on 'the case,' which context suggests is related to Epstein.
Maxwell is the subject of a defamation case mentioned in documents related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Page Six reports on Epstein's relationships
events.description: Page Six publishes an article reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, which Peter Skinner forwards via email.

events.title: Meeting and document sharing
events.description: Peter Skinner thanks someone for a meeting and attaches legal documents including a complaint against Ghislaine Maxwell and a redacted FBI 302 form.

events.title: Request for meeting notes
events.description: An email is sent requesting any notes and/or records from a meeting with Peter Skinner and asking if there were any other meetings relating to Epstein.

keyFacts: In March 2016, Peter Skinner forwarded a Page Six article reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women.
In February 2016, Peter Skinner shared legal documents including a complaint against Ghislaine Maxwell and a redacted FBI 302 form related to the Epstein case.
In December 2018, there was an active request for notes and records from a meeting with Peter Skinner regarding Epstein, indicating ongoing investigative interest.
